[[Clarksdale, Mississippi|Clarksdale]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]] | death_date = | origin = | instrument = [[Vocals]], [[harmonica]], [[guitar]] | genre = [[Blues]] | occupation = [[Musician]], [[singer]] | years_active = Late 1970s–present | label = Icehouse Records | associated_acts = | website = [http://www.myspace.com/blindmississippimorris Official website] | notable_instruments = }} '''Blind Mississippi Morris''' (born '''Morris Cummings''', April 6, 1955, [[Clarksdale, Mississippi|Clarksdale]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[musician|artist]].{{cite book|last1=Urgo|first1=Joseph R.|last2=Abadie|first2=Ann J.|title=Faulkner's inheritance: Faulkner and Yoknapatawpha, 2005|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=FVFi6H5seskC&pg=PA68|accessdate=27 September 2011|year=2007|publisher=Univ. Press of Mississippi|isbn=978-1-57806-953-8|pages=68–}} ==Overview== {{Multiple issues|section=yes|{{Neutrality|section|date=April 2014}}{{peacock|section|date=April 2014}}{{puffery|section|date=April 2014}}}} Cummings lost his sight at the age of four, but that did not stop him from learning the blues. Morris has become a popular blues act on [[Beale Street]]. Morris and his band, the Pocket Rockets, are known as the "real deal from Beale". Morris has a talented lineage. His [[cousin]]s, Robert and Mary Diggs, led the Memphis Sheiks, and his aunt, Mary Tanner, played with the Harps of Melody. Morris is also a cousin of the late [[Willie Dixon]]. Morris is the very embodiment of the [[Delta blues]]man. He has been called a new disciple of the Delta blues, he was rated one of the 10 best [[harmonica]] players in the world by ''Bluzharp'' [[magazine]]. He has performed with musicians such as [[B. B. King]], [[Rufus Thomas]], [[Muddy Waters]], [[David Porter (musician)|David Porter]] and many other [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]], [[Tennessee]] artists. ==See also== *[[List of blues musicians]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.icehouserecords.com/artists/blindmsmorris/index.html Blind Mississippi Morris - Icehouse Records] *[http://www.cduniverse.com/search/xx/music/pid/5457738/a/You+Know+I+Like+That.htm/ Blind Mississippi Morris - You Know I Like That CD] *[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1717031/ Blind Mississippi Morris - IMDB Filmography] *[http://www.rockabillyhall.com/museum.html Memphis Rock & Soul Museum] *[http://vimeo.com/25412612 Short bio/doc on Blind Mississippi Morris] {{Persondata | NAME =Morris, Blind Mississippi | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =[[United States|American]] [[blues]] musician | DATE OF BIRTH =April 6, 1955 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Clarksdale, Mississippi|Clarksdale]], [[Mississippi]], [[United States]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Morris, Blind Mississippi}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Clarksdale, Mississippi]] [[Category:Blind musicians]] [[Category:American blues musicians]] [[Category:American blues harmonica players]] [[Category:Blind bluesmen]] [[Category:Blues musicians from Mississippi]]
